#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=2. Background
#Text=Emotion detection based on physiological data are a vibrant research field that has produced a large body of studies focusing on different emotions and analysis approaches .
#Text=This section provides an overview of the previous physiology-based emotion detection research relevant to our study .
#Text=In our literature review , we searched previous studies in Google Scholar with searching keywords of “ Emotion ” , “ Boredom ” , “ Classification ” , “ Physiology ” , and “ Sensor ” .
#Text=We did not set limitations on the publication year or forum ; however , we excluded studies that classified emotions solely by interviews or surveys .
#Text=Several AC studies focusing on emotion classification from physiological data referred to Russell ’s Circumplex model (
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=) to explain the target emotion .
#Text=The model categorizes emotions into four groups by the dimensions of valance and arousal .
#Text=According to the model , boredom is categorized into the low-valence low-arousal group ( red box in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=) .
#Text=Despite the simplicity of the way in which the Circumplex model assigns boredom to the third quadrant , boredom is considered a complex emotion as various studies have defined it differently .

#Text=Vogel-Walcutt et al. ’ s literature review resulted in 37 definitions of boredom , and concluded that “ boredom occurs when an individual experiences both the neurological state of low arousal and the psychological state of dissatisfaction , frustration , or disinterest in response to the low arousal . ” .
#Text=The conclusions of Russell ’s model and Vogel-Walcutt et al. ’ s definition are thus similar .
#Text=In contrast , the range of boredom in Eastwood et al. ’ s definition is wider than that of Russell ’s model .
#Text=According to their study , people who are in a low-valence state can feel boredom regardless of the level of arousal .
#Text=Considering these studies , we conclude that a universally accepted definition of boredom does not exist .
#Text=Some previous studies regarding boredom categorized it as a trait , while others handled it as a state .
#Text=The meaning of trait in boredom-related studies is the proneness of an individual to become bored , thus there is a difference between easily becoming bored , and being able to resist boredom .
#Text=Conversely , the meaning of a state is the current state of boredom that the person is experiencing .
#Text=Fahlman et al. handled boredom as a trait , while Eastwood et al. and Kim et al. treated it as a state .
#Text=In this study , we approach boredom as a state .
#Text=The reason for this is that we hypothesize that , when a person feels bored , changes in their physiological signals can be identified .
#Text=Our literature review identified nine studies on boredom classification from physiological data sources as listed in Table 1 .
#Text=It reveals that seven studies used more than one data source ; this approach of sensor fusion is a common technique to increase the detection accuracy .
#Text=The median number of participants in these studies was 21 , which is relatively small compared to other cases where machine learning methods are typically applied .
#Text=In the individual source perspective , EEG was used by three studies , and GSR was utilized by four studies .
#Text=However , to the best of our knowledge , no previous study has used both EEG and GSR data for classifying boredom .
#Text=Sanei and Chambers and Ashwal and Rust showed that EEG data correlates with emotion states of humans .
#Text=Furthermore , GSR is related to the autonomic nervous system , which is also known to correlate with emotion states , thus GSR can be utilized as a potential source for emotion classification .
#Text=In the physiological perspective , EEG data are captured from the activity of the brain , which belongs to the nervous system together with GSR .
#Text=Moreover , the analysis on the characteristics of boredom conducted by Bench and Lench suggested that boredom should be associated with the increased autonomic nervous system activity .
#Text=This linkage implies that a correlation may exist between boredom , EEG and GSR , but so far it has not been investigated in previous studies .
#Text=Table 2 presents the methods and the accuracy results of the previous studies that classified boredom using physiological data .

#Text=Mandryk and Atkins , D’Mello et al. , Giakoumis et al. , and Kim et al. focused on finding correlations between boredom and physiological data using statistical approaches , thus they did not generate classification models .
#Text=The other reviewed boredom classification studies built classification models using machine learning algorithms and measured the performance of the models .
#Text=However , these studies did not address the issue of overfitting carefully , making it difficult to guarantee the robustness of the results .
#Text=Moreover , many previous studies lacked the discussion on the choice of the classification algorithms and only considered a few limited algorithms .
#Text=Therefore , it is necessary to consider the potential of a wider range of classification algorithms to classify boredom .
#Text=Considering these facts and shortcomings of previous studies , our study aims to produce reliable performance results based on more diverse machine learning methods .
